page.title: 08"Bowcombe"-Farming Changes 1
page.content: All the farmers in the area, and the older men in particular, testify to the dramatic changes which have taken place in farming in the last 50 years: akin to{a second Agricultural {Revolution.} {The most important have been the {developments in machinery which have {greatly improved efficiency, but more {significantly for society have reduced {dramatically the number of people {employed in farming.}Of the cottages along the road which 50 years ago were almost all occupied by farm workers; only one is so occupied. Most have been bought for use as retirement homes or holiday homes by people, many of whom are from the mainland. {A total dependence on machinery also {brings problems when that machinery {breaks down. "Repairs are expensive {and spares are unobtainable".}
